Articles.Content:
So I'm using KSP for a science project, and while I'd usually attempt to experiment on my own to do this and try and design one myself, I don't have the time. I need a spaceship that is capable of orbiting virtually every body in the solar system.

In case you're wondering, my project is about how the gravitational field and what not affects the orbital velocity of a regular orbit and a synchronous orbit.

If you're using this for a project rather than to play the game, why not just turn on infinite fuel and have something simple like a MK1 pod, tiny fuel can, and swivel engine? Should go anywhere with cheats on
use hyperedit for your project. so you can cheat a "stock lander" to EVERY body in EVERY height... watch out for game crashes while playing around
